title: " No negatives needed": weakly-supervised regression for interpretable tumor detection in whole-slide histopathology images
details: M D'Amato, J van der Laak, F Ciompi - arXiv preprint arXiv:2502.21109, 2025
abstract: Accurate tumor detection in digital pathology whole-slide images (WSIs) is crucial for cancer diagnosis and treatment planning. Multiple Instance Learning (MIL) has emerged as a widely used approach for weakly-supervised tumor detection with …

title: Bilevel Optimized Implicit Neural Representation for Scan-Specific Accelerated MRI Reconstruction
details: H Yu, JA Fessler, Y Jiang - arXiv preprint arXiv:2502.21292, 2025
abstract: Deep Learning (DL) methods can reconstruct highly accelerated magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scans, but they rely on application-specific large training datasets and often generalize poorly to out-of-distribution data. Self-supervised deep …
